title: Picks & Bans: Fnatic can’t be nailed down at MSI

replies.body: NA > EU
Please don't start this garbage
Thank you :)
is this solo q?
Too bad this is Steelback's last time with the team
Rekkless doesnt even deserve that spot anymore. He left looking for greener pastures and failed horribly.
Ya I think it's a pretty scumbag thing to do and he just seems like somebody that causes drama when things don't go his way, but I still think he's a better individual player than Steelback

Yeah, but they also won based on team play and cohesion. I find it hard to believe that all 4 people are gonna trust and have good cohesion w/ someone who decided to leave the team because he wanted to play on a team that looked better, and then left them to come back when it didn't work out. (Especially since he had to really work hard to leave in the first place because he had to break the contract he had and the buyout clause was stupid expensive.)

it was the best decision back then. you cant blame him for being with the strongest team and its very possible that fnatic reached out to him in the first place.

just remember the article on the fnatic homepage when rekkles left, it was something like this: "we say goodbye to rekkles, for now"
wait, is rekkles coming back to FNC ?
Ya he'll be replacing Steeelback once MSI is over

I really think that if Rekkles is coming back he should be placed as sub, and he would need to earn his place back... Putting Steelback aside just like that isn't fair nor wise, Steelback knowing it's his last time in the team may intencionally or not change his playstyle and affect the team synergy :/

Anyone else considering boycotting watching Fnatic games over this? Seriously, I think dropping someone who has played well and tried really hard for you in favor of someone who jumped ship and wants back on now (it's a character issue really), is one of only two things this season that anyone at Riot or in the LCS has done that made me want to change my viewing behavior to ensure they don't receive add profits from me.
Oh what do I see here? An EU article? Oh, no, not quite likely, it's more like a MSI article, but still, it's something! :D
It's ok guys we got an eu article :D

TSM is gonna stomp Fnatic!

Now, EU fan boys & girls get your angry comments ready and we can get the NA/EU rivalry started early!
Booring!
Where's your sense of fun?
Guess at the same place, where u left the stuff thats actually funny :)
OH BURN
I got my out so get your fun out and have some!:D Come on DeathscytheDuo, show us all that legendary EUW RAGE{{champion:23}}
I think in retrospect, Fnatic did what the best rage couldnt have. :)
Save that for Twitch chat please! :)

Am I the only one who thinks team rivalries are better than regional rivalries? The more and more esports becomes a legitimate competition, the less regional ties have to do with anything other than where the market is. NBA, NFL, MLB all have a ton of players who didn't grow up in the US, but they are the dominant leagues because the US is where the money is at. If there are enough fans and a big revenue difference between leagues then the one with the biggest audience and thus biggest investment from teams/owners will end up being the strongest (look at the shift between Korea and China scenes this year) so it isn't super interesting to talk about which region has the most fans who pay for stuff and motivate teams to invest in players. Teams in the same region will always be striving to compete and the top teams are usually on similar levels though, so team rivalries>region rivalries imo.
aaaaaaand you failed
I hope the west shows up. Though optimistic, I want the final to be TSM vs Fnatic
Na>World
Eheheh
Let's go Fnatic! You're always really fun to watch, and it's time for you to prove that Europe can still do well in international tournaments!
the AHQ video was really great and showed information about the team. this video was more of a "EU LCS" video rather than being about fnatic. i am quite dissapointed to be frank

Really? I will never get the thought process on complaining because Riot hasn't done something for your region, then when they get to it (because articles take time to write, film, etc) it gets responses like this.

No wonder Riot doesn't want to create more EU content, they get snide and snippy remarks like this. Well we are disappointed in your disappointment.

i am not complaining about EU content! first, this is MSI content. second, while it is true that lolesports lacks EU articles i am not a bread and can understand the reason behind this and dont count to the poeple who just complain about it.

i stated perfectly clear why the AHQ video was better in my opinion and that is critisism and not complaining

If you read the entire article you would see it is focused on Fnatic. So the video was more about the EU LCS stats (the article series is called Pick & Ban so this may be expected). Fnatic are a widely popular team AHQ not so much, I can see the reasoning for why the video and article differ from the AHQ one.

The article is perfectly written, adds information about the team that new fans or just fans of esports in general can find useful and it does a positively successful job at promoting the team for MSI.

In your original post you expressed disappointment that Riot did something different instead of just the same boring thing for each 
"Pick & Ban" article/video. You find disappointment in that which is your opinion to have, but I find that it makes me want to read the content and watch the video because I don't know what it is going to be and cannot assume it is the same layout every single time.

All of this is my opinion, but it would probably be helpful for more EU content if when it came out it wasn't shot down with "disappointments".

i am aware of that. just that i didnt mentioned the article? the article is perfectly fine. whats wrong with you people putting words in my mouth?

also i didnt said i want the same video but this are videos about the teams of MSI so i want to get some quick information about the team in the video. i bet many people just watch the video and dont read the article. what is with them? is it so difficult to understand my point?

i always stress thats its just my opinion and if you cant speak out loud if you are dissapointed something is really off

You yourself mentioned being disappointed in your original post! 

No one is putting any words in your mouth, everything is about the context of how you put and what you put out there. Case in point your original post points out that this Video is more about EU LCS where as AHQs was more about the team. You made a comparison followed by your disappointment. That is the basis for me replying to your comment at all.

And yes I understand it is your opinion that is not an issue, I had a disagreement with the way your opinion seemed to avoid that fact that this article (the entire thing video and all) was directed at Fnatic information. Even though the video was focused on EU LCS Stats.
Your argument lacks any logic... NA gets like 3 articles every week. If you release single article for EU in a month, ofc you want it to be perfect. Get it pal?

Your argument is ridiculous.  And  it seems you lack basic understanding. 

Please troll elsewhere.
More like Korea can't be nailed down.

Watched all the playoffs of different regions and don't expect much from Europe this season... I hope we improve on Summer Split to get a chance at worlds, but there's loads to improve. On UOL vs Fnatic you see some strategic mistakes that you don't see on top tier teams in other regions. Seeing UOL on finals was good and their semi-finals vs SKT were fun to watch, but on the finals you can clearly see they are a team that needs to mature a lot. That such team was a finalist on Spring Split says a lot about where Europe stands against other regions. I am looking forward for SKT vs GE Tigers and then MSI!! So far this has been the most fun/competitive season worldwide!!

I think this is just a rebuilding split in eu they have so many teams that got a bunch of new players. They would have done better if the elements hype stayed up to standards. I honestly don't think fnatic thought they would win the split. I think they just wanted to rebuild the team

UOL has a weird play style that somehow always manages to turn games into a scrappy back and forth brawl with long team fights that span over entire respawns. I have no idea how it always happens but I wouldn't put too much weight on how teams fare vs it and just hope that EU is a stronger region for going up against a different play style. I'm hoping to see the top teams going head to head result in mixed losses from each team but maybe it's just optimistic to hope for an international tournament that has more than 2 teams likely to win it.
All of these NA fan boys make me sad to be from the same region as them. In there place I would like to apologize to all of the EU peeps.
I'm curious how an almost new roster from last year does this well with players relatively unknown in the LCS.
Anyone else curious if Steelback's performance will be affected by the fact that he's being replaced by Rekkles next split after helping Fnatic to a Spring Split 1st place???

I am very excited for theese match ups my favorites of them is prolly Fnc VS Tsm. I can't imagine the excuses of either of the regions depending whom loses. I wonder wich region is going to be most salty? What do you think?
I don't get what these intro videos are even for anymore... Those numbers aren't even remotely impressive...
Фнатик, фпирет! Аднасначна!
hahah they really think EU is gonna be good in an international tournament hahhahaah.... they will lose imediatley ^^
Or maybe not ^^
